meanings.definition: To focus all one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the test, Sarah had to concentrate on solving the math problems.
meanings.sent2: I need to concentrate on finishing my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to concentrate on catching the laser pointer dot.
meanings.sent4: She had to concentrate her energy on the final sprint of the race.
meanings.sent5: The students had to concentrate hard to remember all the new vocabulary words.

meanings.definition: A substance made by removing or reducing the diluting agent; a concentrated form of something.
meanings.sent1: The orange juice concentrate was used to make a refreshing drink.
meanings.sent2: I added a spoonful of coffee concentrate to my cup for a stronger flavor.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the fruit concentrate all over the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The cleaning solution was a powerful concentrate that required dilution before use.
meanings.sent5: The detergent concentrate was highly effective in removing tough stains.

meanings.definition: To bring or come to a single point or focus.
meanings.sent1: The sun's rays seemed to concentrate on the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The speaker tried to concentrate the audience's attention on the main idea.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter seemed to concentrate in the playground.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes helped to concentrate the viewer's gaze on the focal point.
meanings.sent5: The coach's instructions were meant to concentrate the team's efforts on defense.
